data.text: @BillProudfit @webbhk I can’t even remember how many times I have seen this statement every time there is an outbreak in a Chinese city. And every single time, it was controlled.
@Jackalbion @webbhk Although I wasn't far off... https://t.co/MkrVI21Ri4
@Jackalbion @JameDiBiasio @webbhk Could be both, because why not.
@Jackalbion @webbhk You mean my totally unscientific, off-the-cuff musing was somehow inaccurate? Dang.
@JameDiBiasio @webbhk It was already there... at least 2 weeks ago... Nothing to do with fleeing HKers.

@webbhk Rank speculation, pure hot take: maybe triggered by mainlanders fleeing HK illegally, because scared of being sent to a Covid concentration camp. So if HK had been allowed to manage this crisis without the Zero-Covid handcuffs, transmission to mainland might never have occurred.
@webbhk Assume underreporting by a factor of 4. Thé asymptomatic will be spreading the 🦠 rapidly. Ready to rock-n-roll Shenzhen.
